stimulusHtml: In the late nineteenth century, which of the following would most motivate the Dutch to continue to expand their presence in Indonesia?

features.html:
A SKETCH BY JAN BRANDES, DUTCH LUTHERAN MINISTER LIVING IN JAKARTA, INDONESIA, 1784

Rijksmuseum, Amsterdam, The Netherlands / Bridgeman Images

The sketch shows the artist’s son Johnny and Flora, an enslaved Indonesian household servant.

choicesHtml: The acquisition of natural resources for manufacturing
The growing competition with Spanish and Portuguese colonial empires
The example of Japanese modernization during the Meiji Restoration
